scope_note: Curated timeline of major AI model releases and major version upgrades from Jan 2025 to Feb 24, 2026. Not exhaustive (minor patches, silent rollouts, and region-limited experiments are often omitted). Impact levels are qualitative and reflect a mix of mainstream coverage, developer adoption signals, and downstream effects (product defaults, open-weight forks, policy/legal responses).

impact_legend.watershed: A clear 'industry moment' that shifted public narrative or competitive dynamics.
impact_legend.high: Widely discussed and/or quickly adopted; strong downstream effects.
impact_legend.medium: Important to practitioners/ecosystem, but narrower spread.
impact_legend.low: Niche or limited rollout; modest downstream impact.

context_before_2025.title: DeepSeek-V3 introduced (sets the stage for the 2025 'DeepSeek moment')
context_before_2025.description: DeepSeek introduced DeepSeek-V3 near the end of 2024; its performance/cost narrative primed the community for the major 2025 wave of DeepSeek adoption and comparisons.
context_before_2025.why_it_mattered: Even though the release date is in 2024, the model's visibility and comparisons carried strongly into early 2025 and framed how people interpreted later R1/V3.x drops.

sources.label: DeepSeek — DeepSeek-R1 release page (lists prior DeepSeek-V3 introduction)
Hugging Face — One year since the DeepSeek moment

events.title: DeepSeek-R1 released (reasoning model, open weights)
events.description: DeepSeek released R1 as a reasoning-focused model and also published distilled smaller models, emphasizing permissive use and community re-use.
events.why_it_mattered: This was quickly framed as a 'DeepSeek moment'—a strong open-weights reasoning release that pushed global conversation about cost/performance and open ecosystems.

sources.label: Hugging Face — One year since the DeepSeek moment

events.title: Qwen2.5-Max announced (large-scale MoE model)
events.description: Qwen announced Qwen2.5-Max, a large MoE model trained on a very large token corpus and made available via Alibaba Cloud / Qwen Chat.
events.why_it_mattered: Part of the early-2025 China LLM acceleration cycle: rapid releases and marketing pushes following DeepSeek’s visibility.

sources.label: Reuters — Qwen 3 coverage referencing earlier Qwen2.5-Max release

events.title: OpenAI o3-mini released (cost-effective small reasoning model)
events.description: OpenAI released o3-mini as the most cost-efficient small model in its reasoning series, with options for different reasoning effort levels.
events.why_it_mattered: A key step in 'reasoning for everyone'—pushing stronger STEM/coding reasoning into lower-cost tiers and widening developer usage.

sources.label: OpenAI Help Center — Model release notes (o3-mini)

events.title: Gemini 2.0 Flash (Vertex AI model version recorded)
events.description: Vertex AI model version pages record Gemini 2.0 Flash availability for developers/enterprises (model IDs vary by platform/versioning).
events.why_it_mattered: Less of a viral moment and more of a practical adoption milestone: enterprises could standardize around a new default workhorse model.

sources.label: Google Cloud — Vertex AI model versions
Google — Gemini app powered by Gemini 2.0 Flash (January 2025 update post)

events.title: xAI Grok 3 released (flagship model)
events.description: Reuters reported xAI’s launch of Grok 3 as a competitor in the flagship-chatbot race.
events.why_it_mattered: Because X is both the product surface and the distribution channel, Grok releases tend to spread quickly through social discourse and mainstream coverage.

events.title: Gemini 2.0 Flash-Lite (Vertex AI model version recorded)
events.description: Vertex AI model version pages record Gemini 2.0 Flash-Lite as a lighter, cost-oriented variant for production workloads.
events.why_it_mattered: Cost-optimized variants often matter most at scale: they enable more 'always-on' features, higher query volumes, and broader integration.

sources.label: Google Cloud — Vertex AI model versions

events.title: OpenAI GPT-4.5 released (research preview)
events.description: OpenAI released a research preview of GPT-4.5 as a scaled-up general model, emphasizing improved pattern recognition and writing quality.
events.why_it_mattered: A major model-line checkpoint, but the buzz was more 'inside the industry' than the open-weights shockwaves driving broader discourse.

sources.label: OpenAI Help Center — Model release notes (GPT-4.5)

events.title: QwQ-32B released (reasoning model from Qwen)
events.description: Reuters reported Alibaba's release of QwQ-32B, a reasoning-focused model positioned as competitive with other leading reasoning models.
events.why_it_mattered: Highlighted how quickly Chinese labs pivoted into the 'reasoning model' narrative after DeepSeek R1 and others raised the bar.

sources.label: Reuters — Alibaba shares surge after it unveils reasoning model QwQ-32B

events.title: OpenAI 4o Image Generation launched (native image generation/editing)
events.description: OpenAI launched a major upgrade to ChatGPT image generation powered by GPT‑4o, emphasizing accurate text rendering, instruction following, and practical editing.
events.why_it_mattered: Image tools spread via outputs: better text rendering + edit consistency tends to trigger rapid UGC waves (memes, posters, diagrams) and copycat features across competitors.

events.title: DeepSeek-V3-0324 released (open-weights update)
events.description: DeepSeek released V3-0324 as a V3-series update (MIT license), continuing rapid iterations after the early-2025 attention spike.
events.why_it_mattered: Sustained the open-weights pressure: frequent updates keep the community benchmarking, fine-tuning, and redeploying—and keep competitors responding.

events.title: Gemini 2.5 Pro Experimental introduced (thinking model line)
events.description: DeepMind introduced Gemini 2.5 as a 'thinking model' line; Gemini 2.5 Pro Experimental was positioned as the first 2.5 model with strong reasoning and coding.
events.why_it_mattered: Marked Google's formal push to 'hybrid reasoning' as a product line, influencing how the ecosystem talked about reasoning modes and cost/performance tiers.

events.title: Meta Llama 4 released (Scout & Maverick; open-weight multimodal models)
events.description: Meta introduced Llama 4 Scout and Llama 4 Maverick as natively multimodal open-weight models, kickstarting a new wave of open deployment and fine-tuning.
events.why_it_mattered: Open-weight releases trigger an immediate 'benchmark → fine-tune → deploy → compare' loop. Llama 4 also sparked debate around benchmark transparency and variants.

sources.label: Reuters — Meta releases new AI model Llama 4
The Verge — Meta got caught gaming AI benchmarks (context)

events.title: OpenAI GPT-4.1 family released in the API (4.1 / 4.1 mini / 4.1 nano)
events.description: OpenAI launched GPT‑4.1, 4.1 mini, and 4.1 nano in the API, emphasizing instruction-following, tool use, and long context.
events.why_it_mattered: A big developer-facing reset: new default API options often reshape app baselines, prompting guides, and cost/performance expectations.

sources.label: OpenAI — Introducing GPT-4.1 in the API

events.title: OpenAI o3 and o4-mini released (reasoning + tool-capable models)
events.description: OpenAI released o3 and o4-mini as tool-capable reasoning models, emphasizing multi-step problem solving and visual reasoning ('think with images').
events.why_it_mattered: Helped normalize 'agentic tool use' as a baseline expectation for top-tier reasoning models.

events.title: Baidu ERNIE 4.5 Turbo and ERNIE X1 Turbo launched
events.description: Reuters reported Baidu’s launch of ERNIE 4.5 Turbo and ERNIE X1 Turbo, positioned as faster/cheaper upgrades amid intensifying domestic competition.
events.why_it_mattered: Part of the 'price/performance war' dynamic in China: frequent upgrades, price cuts, and rapid productization cycles.

sources.label: Reuters — Baidu launches new AI model amid mounting competition

events.title: Qwen3 unveiled (open-source model family with hybrid reasoning)
events.description: Reuters and Qwen’s blog announced the Qwen3 series, highlighting hybrid reasoning capabilities and a range of sizes (dense + MoE).
events.why_it_mattered: A major open-source event: Qwen drops typically ripple through Hugging Face, benchmark leaderboards, and fine-tuning toolchains within days.

events.title: Google announced new generative media models at I/O (Veo 3, Imagen 4, Lyria 2)
events.description: At I/O 2025, Google highlighted new generative media models: Veo 3 (video), Imagen 4 (image), and expanded access to Lyria 2 (music).
events.why_it_mattered: High-shareability content (video + audio) tends to produce fast viral spread and intensifies concerns about synthetic media misuse and provenance.

sources.label: Google — Generative media models at I/O 2025

events.title: Claude 4 released (Opus 4 and Sonnet 4)
events.description: Anthropic launched Claude 4, including Opus 4 and Sonnet 4, as a major generation jump in the Claude family.
events.why_it_mattered: A big step for enterprise/dev adoption, especially where Anthropic is used as a default for coding and knowledge work.

events.title: DeepSeek-R1-0528 released (reasoning model update)
events.description: DeepSeek shipped an updated R1 checkpoint (R1-0528), continuing rapid iteration on open reasoning models.
events.why_it_mattered: Keeps pressure on both open and closed competitors: iterative open checkpoints enable fast community improvements and adaptation.

sources.label: TechCrunch — DeepSeek updates its R1 reasoning model

events.title: OpenAI o3-pro launched (higher-compute variant of o3)
events.description: OpenAI launched o3-pro as a higher-compute variant of o3 designed to think longer and deliver more reliable results for difficult tasks.
events.why_it_mattered: Strengthened the idea of 'same family, different compute tiers' (Instant/Thinking/Pro patterns) for professional reasoning workloads.

sources.label: OpenAI Help Center — Model release notes (o3-pro)

events.title: Gemini 2.5 Pro and Gemini 2.5 Flash become generally available
events.description: DeepMind announced Gemini 2.5 Pro and 2.5 Flash as stable/GA models, alongside introducing 2.5 Flash-Lite in preview.
events.why_it_mattered: GA status is when enterprises commit: stability, pricing, and deprecation windows drive real deployment decisions.

events.title: Veo 3 rolled out more broadly (video generation model availability expansion)
events.description: TechCrunch reported broader rollout of Veo 3 beyond the initial announcement window.
events.why_it_mattered: For generative video, the 'broader availability' moment often creates the real viral surge because more creators can publish outputs at once.

sources.label: TechCrunch — Google rolls out Veo 3 globally

events.title: GLM-4.5 released (open-source model)
events.description: Reuters reported that Zhipu released GLM-4.5 as an open-source model, adding to the fast-moving Chinese open-model landscape.
events.why_it_mattered: A meaningful node for the Chinese open ecosystem—more choices for local deployment, fine-tuning, and application stacks.

sources.label: Reuters — Zhipu releases open-source model GLM-4.5

events.title: gpt-oss released (OpenAI open-weight reasoning models: 120B and 20B)
events.description: OpenAI released open-weight models gpt-oss-120b and gpt-oss-20b, positioned as open-weight reasoning models.
events.why_it_mattered: OpenAI entering open-weight competition amplified benchmarking and prompted ecosystem comparisons vs. Llama/Qwen/DeepSeek.

events.title: GPT-5 released (unified system; new defaults in ChatGPT and API)
events.description: OpenAI launched GPT‑5 as a unified system with built-in thinking and multiple sizes in the API (gpt-5, mini, nano).
events.why_it_mattered: Default-model shifts force ecosystem migration: prompting guides, evaluation baselines, and product experiences realign around the new default.

events.title: Imagen 4 family generally available in the Gemini API
events.description: Google Developers Blog announced Imagen 4 (and variants) as generally available in the Gemini API for developers.
events.why_it_mattered: GA image generation with strong text rendering tends to trigger more 'design workflow' adoption (marketing assets, UI mockups) beyond hobby use.

sources.label: Google Developers Blog — Imagen 4 GA in Gemini API

events.title: DeepSeek-V3.1 released (open-weights update)
events.description: DeepSeek shipped V3.1 as another MIT-licensed update in the V3 line.
events.why_it_mattered: A continuation of the 'high-frequency open releases' strategy—less dramatic than the initial DeepSeek moment, but cumulatively influential.

events.title: Gemini 2.5 Flash Image introduced (codename 'Nano Banana')
events.description: Google introduced Gemini 2.5 Flash Image (a fast image generation/editing model). The 'Nano Banana' codename became associated with viral image-editing trends.
events.why_it_mattered: Shareable edits (especially accurate text in images and strong instruction following) created a social flywheel of prompts and remixes.

sources.label: Google Developers Blog — Introducing Gemini 2.5 Flash Image (Nano Banana)
The Verge — Nano Banana 3D figurine trend

events.title: Claude Sonnet 4.5 released
events.description: Anthropic released Claude Sonnet 4.5 as an upgrade in the Sonnet line, focused on broad improvements for coding and knowledge work.
events.why_it_mattered: A steady enterprise/dev upgrade cycle—important for teams standardizing on Sonnet as a default model tier.

events.title: Sora 2 launched (video generation model)
events.description: OpenAI launched Sora 2, emphasizing more realistic and controllable video generation with synchronized dialogue and sound effects.
events.why_it_mattered: Video output is inherently viral: each demo clip acts as marketing, and every jump in realism escalates provenance and misuse debates.

events.title: DeepSeek-V3.2-Exp released (experimental iteration)
events.description: DeepSeek continued iterating the V3 line with an experimental V3.2-Exp release.
events.why_it_mattered: Sustains momentum via continuous checkpoints—useful for the community even when single releases aren't headline moments.

events.title: Gemini 2.5 Flash Image (Vertex AI model version recorded)
events.description: Vertex AI model versions record stable/packaged Gemini 2.5 Flash Image availability (IDs vary by platform).
events.why_it_mattered: When image models become stable and easy to integrate, they move from 'demo' to 'workflow' (marketing ops, design tooling, content pipelines).

sources.label: Google Cloud — Vertex AI model versions
Gemini API deprecations (mentions flash-image preview → stable)

events.title: gpt-oss-safeguard released (safety-focused open models)
events.description: OpenAI introduced gpt-oss-safeguard models and related safety tooling aimed at improved multi-policy accuracy for moderation/safety classification.
events.why_it_mattered: Signaled a trend toward publishing smaller, specialized safety models alongside general open-weight models.

events.title: GPT-5.1 released (more conversational GPT-5 series upgrade)
events.description: OpenAI released GPT‑5.1 as an upgrade to the GPT‑5 series, focusing on a smarter, more conversational ChatGPT and better customization.
events.why_it_mattered: A meaningful 'default quality' upgrade: incremental improvements can matter more than new features when they land for everyone.

events.title: ERNIE 5.0 unveiled (natively omni-modal foundation model)
events.description: Baidu unveiled ERNIE 5.0 and a suite of AI applications at Baidu World 2025, emphasizing omni-modal modeling and product integration.
events.why_it_mattered: A major China-market foundation model release; global influence depends on access and developer distribution.

events.title: Gemini 3 introduced (new era of Gemini models)
events.description: Google introduced Gemini 3 as a major generation update to its core model family.
events.why_it_mattered: A flagship-gen refresh with broad distribution across Google products creates wide indirect impact even if many users don't notice the model name.

sources.label: Google — A new era of intelligence with Gemini 3

events.title: GPT-5.1-Codex-Max released (agentic coding model)
events.description: OpenAI introduced GPT‑5.1‑Codex‑Max as a higher-capability agentic coding model designed for long-running tasks and large codebases.
events.why_it_mattered: Reinforced the shift from 'chat coding' to 'agentic coding' with long-horizon execution and tool use.

events.title: Nano Banana Pro introduced (Gemini 3 Pro Image Preview-based image generation/editing)
events.description: Google introduced Nano Banana Pro, positioned as a stronger text rendering + image editing model and rolled it into multiple Google products.
events.why_it_mattered: A classic 'viral capability' moment: better in-image text and edit consistency makes outputs more shareable and drives demand spikes (sometimes requiring throttling).

sources.label: The Verge — Nano Banana Pro coverage

events.title: Claude Opus 4.5 released
events.description: Anthropic released Claude Opus 4.5 as an upgrade to its top-tier Opus line for coding, agents, and enterprise workflows.
events.why_it_mattered: A steady top-tier upgrade that matters for teams using Opus as their 'best effort' model for difficult tasks.

events.title: DeepSeek-V3.2 released (open-weights update)
events.description: DeepSeek released V3.2 as another MIT-licensed update to the V3 line.
events.why_it_mattered: Continued the cadence that keeps the open ecosystem benchmarking and building on DeepSeek checkpoints.

events.title: Mistral Large 3 (25.12) released
events.description: Mistral released Mistral Large 3 (25.12) as an updated large model offering.
events.why_it_mattered: A relevant enterprise/European ecosystem upgrade, especially where Mistral is the preferred vendor for regional deployment needs.

events.title: GPT-5.2 released (frontier upgrade for professional work & long-running agents)
events.description: OpenAI released GPT‑5.2, emphasizing stronger reasoning, long-context understanding, and more reliable agentic tool use for end-to-end tasks.
events.why_it_mattered: Major platform-level upgrade that often triggers tooling updates (prompting, evals, cost planning) across the ecosystem.

sources.label: OpenAI — GPT-5 System Card update for GPT-5.2

events.title: New ChatGPT Images launched (new flagship image generation model)
events.description: OpenAI released a new version of ChatGPT Images powered by a new flagship image generation model, focusing on precise edits and faster generation.
events.why_it_mattered: Image creation/editing improvements are highly visible and tend to spread via social media outputs and workflow adoption (design, marketing, docs).

sources.label: OpenAI — The new ChatGPT Images is here

events.title: Gemini 3 Flash launched (default model in the Gemini app and AI Mode in Search)
events.description: Google launched Gemini 3 Flash and made it the default model in the Gemini app and AI Mode in Search.
events.why_it_mattered: Default placement drives massive implicit reach: many users experience the model without opting in, which can shift expectations for speed/cost and capability.

sources.label: Google — Gemini 3 Flash: frontier intelligence built for speed

events.title: GPT-5.2-Codex released (agentic coding model)
events.description: OpenAI introduced GPT‑5.2‑Codex as an agentic coding model, positioned for long-running coding tasks and strong security-oriented code analysis.
events.why_it_mattered: Accelerated the arms race in coding agents by pushing stronger automated code review, patch generation, and multi-step repo work.

events.title: Kimi K2.5 released (open-source model + coding agent)
events.description: TechCrunch reported that Moonshot released Kimi K2.5 as a new open-source model alongside a coding agent.
events.why_it_mattered: Adds competitive pressure in the Chinese open ecosystem; impact grows if the model becomes a popular fine-tuning base or powers widely-used apps.

sources.label: TechCrunch — Moonshot releases Kimi K2.5 and a coding agent

events.title: OpenAI announced retirement of GPT-4o and older models (ChatGPT-side migration)
events.description: OpenAI announced retiring GPT‑4o and other older models in ChatGPT, forcing a migration to newer defaults.
events.why_it_mattered: Forced migrations matter because they change real workflows overnight: prompt habits, eval baselines, and tool integrations must adapt.

sources.label: OpenAI — Retiring GPT-4o and older models

events.title: Claude Opus 4.6 released
events.description: Anthropic released Claude Opus 4.6 as an upgrade to its top-tier model, including a 1M token context window (beta) and improved coding/agent reliability.
events.why_it_mattered: Strengthened Anthropic’s position in agentic coding and long-context enterprise work; large-context upgrades often trigger new app architectures.

events.title: GPT-5.3-Codex released (most capable agentic coding model at launch)
events.description: OpenAI introduced GPT‑5.3‑Codex as a faster, more capable agentic coding model combining frontier coding with strong reasoning/pro knowledge.
events.why_it_mattered: Another step-change in coding agents: pushes longer, more autonomous repo work and raises the baseline for competitive coding tooling.

events.title: Seedance 2.0 launched (multimodal audio+video generation)
events.description: ByteDance launched Seedance 2.0, emphasizing a unified multimodal architecture for joint audio-video generation and creative workflows.
events.why_it_mattered: A highly viral capability in practice: realistic video + audio outputs tend to spread fast, and Seedance 2.0 also triggered notable copyright/legal reactions in media coverage.

events.title: GPT-5.3-Codex-Spark released (real-time coding model, research preview)
events.description: OpenAI released a research preview of GPT‑5.3‑Codex‑Spark as a smaller, ultra-low-latency model designed for real-time coding.
events.why_it_mattered: Significant for developer UX: real-time speed changes how coding assistants feel and enables new interactive experiences (pair programming, live refactors).

events.title: Gemini 3 Deep Think announced (science/research/engineering push)
events.description: DeepMind announced Gemini 3 Deep Think as an update aimed at advancing science, research, and engineering use cases.
events.why_it_mattered: Signals intensifying competition on 'deep reasoning modes' and high-end research workflows, not just chat quality.

events.title: Doubao 2.0 released (ByteDance chatbot/model refresh)
events.description: Reuters reported ByteDance’s release of Doubao 2.0 as a significant update in China’s chatbot/model race.
events.why_it_mattered: Impacts domestic distribution: ByteDance’s consumer reach can quickly translate model updates into user acquisition and app ecosystem shifts.

events.title: Qwen 3.5 unveiled (agentic AI focus)
events.description: Reuters reported Alibaba’s launch of Qwen 3.5 positioned for the 'agentic AI era', including visual agentic capabilities across devices/apps.
events.why_it_mattered: Represents the China-market escalation toward agents that act across apps, not just answer questions.

events.title: Claude Sonnet 4.6 released
events.description: Anthropic released Claude Sonnet 4.6 with broad upgrades across coding, computer use, long-context reasoning, and agent planning (1M context beta).
events.why_it_mattered: A high-impact upgrade because Sonnet tends to be the 'workhorse tier' for many teams; improving it shifts day-to-day productivity for a large user base.

events.title: Gemini 3.1 Pro released
events.description: DeepMind announced Gemini 3.1 Pro as Google’s most advanced model for complex tasks, rolling out across consumer and developer products.
events.why_it_mattered: A flagship reasoning upgrade with wide distribution across Gemini app, API, Vertex AI, and NotebookLM—likely to reshape benchmark narratives and enterprise deployments.
